sentences.en: As a member of the nobility, his life had been one of wealth and privilege.
sentences.cn: 身为贵族中的一员, 他过着有钱有势的生活.

sentences.en: Dainty sauces are the life, the nobility of famous dishes.
sentences.cn: 美味的调料给上等佳肴以生命和华贵.

sentences.en: Earls, princes, and kings belong to the nobility.
sentences.cn: 伯爵 、 亲王和国王属于贵族.

sentences.en: He followed his principles with nobility.
sentences.cn: 他高尚地恪守自己的准则.

sentences.en: Her nobility of character made her much admired.
sentences.cn: 她的高尚品格令人钦佩.

sentences.en: In Norman England, the greyhound was a symbol of nobility.
sentences.cn: 灵犭是在诺曼时期的英格兰是高贵的象征。

sentences.en: Many people are uncertain about how to address members of the nobility.
sentences.cn: 许多人不知道怎样称呼贵族家的人.

sentences.en: No title of nobility shall be granted by the United States.
sentences.cn: 合众国不得颁发任何爵位.

sentences.en: She seemed to personify goodness and nobility.
sentences.cn: 她宛如善良和高贵的化身。

sentences.en: The new merchant class was anxious for acceptance by the old nobility.
sentences.cn: 新兴的商业阶层渴望得到旧贵族的接纳.

sentences.en: The new rich aped the nobility.
The power of the nobility continuously increased, until about the year 600 B.C. it became insupportable.
sentences.cn: 贵族的统治日益加强, 到了公元前600年左右,已经变得令人不能忍受了.

sentences.en: These are the things that give science its status and nobility.
sentences.cn: 正是这些,提高了科学的地位和声望.

sentences.en: We call meanness nobility and hatred honor.
sentences.cn: 我们善恶不分,是非不明.
我们家确确实实是名门贵族.

words.tran_cn: 高尚的；贵族的；惰性的；宏伟的
崇高地；高贵地；华丽地；豪爽地

trans.tran_cn: 贵族，高尚的品质，高贵，崇高
trans.tran_en: the group of people in some countries who belong to the highest social class and have titles such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’
